about_the_game:
Dear, Virginia is an open world, third person shooter/adventure set in the aftermath of the American Civil War. The game transports players to a gritty and historically inspired world filled with rich storytelling and immersive gameplay as players will embark on an emotionally charged journey as you assume the role of an enigmatic protagonist named Marcus, a former slave who has now transformed into a relentless civil war hitman.

Adventure
As players traverse the open-world, they'll encounter diverse landscapes, bustling towns, and dangerous territories, with missions to rescue, quests, and paid hits on marked leaders.

Action
Engaging in the game's dynamic combat system, players will unleash their prowess as a hitman, honing their marksmanship skills to take down foes with precision and finesse. Along the way, Marcus will be faced with moral dilemmas and choices that will shape his character, challenging players to consider the impact of their actions on the world and its inhabitants.

The Story
Having endured the heart-wrenching pain of losing his family during his time as a slave, Marcus breaks free from his shackles and emerges as a skilled gunslinger with a singular mission: to reunite with his loved ones, no matter the cost. Guided by his unyielding determination and haunted by his painful past, players must navigate a morally ambiguous landscape where alliances are fluid and every decision made shapes the fate of both Marcus and those he encounters.



Throughout the game, an enthralling narrative unfolds, interweaving themes of freedom, redemption, and justice. Players will forge deep connections with an array of captivating characters, some seeking their own paths to salvation, while others embodying the dark and unpredictable side of the post-war era. Unraveling the truth about Marcus' past and uncovering hidden secrets will be key to discovering the whereabouts of his family and unraveling the mystery that binds them together.

"Dear, Virginia" offers players an open-ended experience, empowering them to forge their own destinies, shape the world around them, and determine Marcus' ultimate fate. As they navigate the harrowing landscapes and undertake perilous missions, they will find themselves immersed in an emotionally charged adventure that tests their courage, ethics, and resilience.

With stunning visuals, a gripping narrative, and a vast open world ripe for exploration, "Dear, Virginia" promises to be an unforgettable gaming experience, leaving players with a profound understanding of the human spirit's unwavering quest for freedom and the enduring power of family bonds.

content_descriptors.notes: there are references to the Civil War and Slavery as the game takes place in 1800s.  Occasional curse words, killing and blood is within the game.
